edu.caltech.sbw
Class VerifiableFile

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--java.io.File
        |
        +--edu.caltech.sbw.VerifiableFile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Comparable, Serializable
public class VerifiableFile
extends File

Extension of java.io.file that adds methods for easily testing whether a given file or directory exists and is accessible.

Usage: 

      File file = new File("/tmp/foo");
      if (file.isVerifiedExistingFile())
          ... do something;
      else
          ... do something else;
Note: The two-argument VerifiableFile constructors do not interpret an empty parent abstract pathname as the current user directory. An empty parent instead causes the child to be resolved against the system-dependent directory defined by the FileSystem.getDefaultParent method. On Unix this default is "/", while on Win32 it is "\\". This is the behavior documented in the java.io.File classes.

Version:
$Revision: 1.2 $
Author:
Michael Hucka, $Author: mhucka $
See Also:
File, Serialized Form

Constructor Detail

VerifiableFile

public VerifiableFile(String pathname)
Creates a new VerifiableFile instance by converting the given pathname string into an abstract pathname.
Parameters:
pathname - A pathname string.

VerifiableFile

public VerifiableFile(File file)
Creates a new VerifiableFile instance by converting the given File parameter into an abstract pathname.
Parameters:
file - A file.

VerifiableFile

public VerifiableFile(String parent,
                      String child)
Creates a new VerifiableFile instance from a parent pathname string and a child pathname string.

If parent is null, then the new VerifiableFile instance is created as if by invoking the single-argument VerifiableFile constructor on the given child pathname string.

Otherwise, the parent pathname string is taken to denote a directory, and the child pathname string is taken to denote either a directory or a file. If the child pathname string is absolute then it is converted into a relative pathname in a system-dependent way. If parent is the empty string then the new VerifiableFile instance is created by converting child into an abstract pathname and resolving the result against a system-dependent default directory. Otherwise, each pathname string is converted into an abstract pathname and the child abstract pathname is resolved against the parent.

Parameters:
parent - The parent pathname string.
child - The child pathname string.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If child is null.

VerifiableFile

public VerifiableFile(File parent,
                      String child)
Creates a new VerifiableFile instance from a parent abstract pathname and a child pathname string.

If parent is null, then the new VerifiableFile instance is created as if by invoking the single-argument VerifiableFile constructor on the given child pathname string.

Otherwise, the parent abstract pathname is taken to denote a directory, and the child pathname string is taken to denote either a directory or a file. If the child pathname string is absolute then it is converted into a relative pathname in a system-dependent way. If parent is empty, then the new VerifiableFile instance is created by converting child into an abstract pathname and resolving the result against a system-dependent default directory. Otherwise, each pathname string is converted into an abstract pathname and the child abstract pathname is resolved against the parent.

Parameters:
parent - The parent pathname string.
child - The child pathname string.
Throws:
NullPointerException - If child is null.
Method Detail

isVerifiedFile

public boolean isVerifiedFile()
Predicate to test that a file is not a directory and is readable to the invoking process.

isVerifiedExistingFile

public boolean isVerifiedExistingFile()
Predicate to test that a file is not a directory, that it exists, and that it is readable to the invoking process.

isVerifiedDirectory

public boolean isVerifiedDirectory()
Predicate to test that a diretory is not a file, that it exists, and that it is readable to the invoking process.
